pr_title: Start DevTools server on first request and handle exceptions

timeline.message: Start DevTools server on first request and handle exceptions

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to dispose() the devToolsInstance here?
timeline.author: devoncarew

replies.bodyText: Is dispose mainly for if an object has dependencies? Since the instance just holds a hostname and port, I think it may not be needed.
replies.author: helin24

replies.bodyText: Gotcha (yeah, it's just needed for heavier weight things).
replies.author: devoncarew

timeline.bodyText: Consider passing the devToolsInstance as a parameter to startServer() so that we always complete the right future (given that this field is reused over time for new instances).
timeline.author: devoncarew

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure if this fully addresses the problem, but I put the future into an atomic reference to ensure that there can only be one at a time (one future, and therefore one process / process handler). It could be problematic if more than one server gets started and the reference to shut it down on close gets lost.
replies.author: helin24

timeline.bodyText: Perhaps rename to devToolsInstanceFuture for clarity?
timeline.author: devoncarew

timeline.message: Make future atomic to ensure only one
